text: Wilf Reginald Cude (4 July 1910 â€“ 5 May 1968) was a NHL ice hockey centre who played 10 seasons for numerous NHL teams. Cude learned to play hockey in Winnipeg. He led the Detroit Red Wings to their first Stanley Cup finals although they lost to the Chicago Black Hawks three games to one in a best-of- five series. ==References== ==Other websites== * * *Wilf Cude 's biography at Manitoba Hockey Hall of Fame Category:1910 births Category:1968 deaths Category:Boston Bruins players Category:Chicago Blackhawks players Category:Detroit Red Wings players Category:Montreal Canadiens players Category:Philadelphia Quakers (NHL) players Category:Sportspeople from Glamorgan Category:Welsh ice hockey players Category:Ice hockey goaltenders
title: Wilf Cude
